page.title: 16A day in the life of Fiona
page.content: On Sundays, my sister Mhairi and I will eventually wake up and go to wake our mum and dad. My mum will get up first, get washed and dressed, and then go for the papers at New Orleans Place in Menzieshill where we live. By the time she comes back we are usually dressed and either watching TV or having breakfast. About ten o'clock we leave for Lochee, a suburb and shopping centre of Dundee, which used to be a village on its own many years ago. We go swimming for about an hour and a half, then go across to Davies' ice cream shop and cafe.We usually walk up to the tennis court and have lunch there.Afterwards we go home and if it is a nice day we lie out for the afternoon.In the evening we will have tea and watch TV or a video before bed.
